intro: Aquilegia moorcroftiana var. afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan columbine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and compound leaves. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, thriving in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, range in color from blue to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
